body_html: I updated the code with all the necessary imports. As for the calculations, yes the individual calculations are small (a few matrix multiplies and cross products), although I'm not sure if it's really all that different from an RNN, at least on the backprop side. A training step is taking 0.37 sec which is about the amount of time taken by a decent sized LSTM.

body: I updated the code with all the necessary imports. As for the calculations, yes the individual calculations are small (a few matrix multiplies and cross products), although I'm not sure if it's really all that different from an RNN, at least on the backprop side. A training step is taking 0.37 sec which is about the amount of time taken by a decent sized LSTM.
